text: Which of the following has become the most frequently used word in popular management books and in academic business literature?
explanation: Innovation has become one of the most frequently used words not only in pop-management books but also in academic business literature. Although making things that you have been doing in better ways or coming up with novel solutions to the ongoing problems is almost as old as humankind, the concept of innovation and technology management and research policy has attracted significant interest starting from the second half of the 20th century.

text: Which of the following is the organizations' and their managers' belief that a brighter future is only possible by?

options.D: Solving ongoing problems almost as old as humankind.
options.E: Developing the dominant organizations virtually in every sector.

explanation: Organizations and their managers believe that a brighter future is only possible by developing and sustaining innovative capabilities (Christensen and Raynor, 2003). Trott (2017: 5) states that the dominant organizations virtually in every sector are more innovative than their closest rivals.

text: Which of the following is true in terms of innovation's effect on today's economical sphere?

options.A: Innovation tends to bring novelty into the economic sphere.
options.B: Innovation is evidently limited in specific applications of companies.
options.C: Innovation is not behind differences in the performance of organizations.
options.D: Innovation is influential explanatory factor in the performances of employers
options.E: Innovation and the performance of regions and countries are strictly limited.

explanation: Today, it is self-evident that innovation tends to bring novelty into the economic sphere, to cluster in specific industries, and is an influential explanatory factor behind differences in the performance of organizations, regions, and countries (Fagerberg,2005: 20).

text: Which of the following is correct for business administration students?

options.A: They should be able to connect the infrastructure with organizational characteristics.
options.B: They should be able to provide technology management for fundamentals of economy with a broader perspective .
options.C: They need to complete their bachelor’s degree before they study the fundamentals of innovation management.
options.D: They should integrate technology, innovation management philosophy and terminology with all they have learned so far.
options.E: They should contextualize managing technology and innovation when it is required for the history of innovation management.

explanation: As a business administration student, you should be able to connect the dots merging these three rankings. That is why, since you are gradually completing your bachelor’s degree, it is time to integrate all you have learned so far with technology and innovation management philosophy and terminology.

text: Which of the following is the reason of the fact that the subject changes accordingly?

options.A: Because the economists always tend to use some terms out of context.
options.B: Because technology and innovation management is a multidisciplinary field.
options.C: Because the economists avoid using an umbrella concept covering all the entities.
options.D: Because not-for-profit/non-governmental organizations prefer to use many concepts interchangeably .
options.E: Because the business scholars prefer using “business” and “companies” to denote different concepts.

explanation: Technology and innovation management is a multidisciplinary field, so the subject changes accordingly. Economists tend to use the term “firm”; business scholars prefer using “business” and “companies” while denoting the same entity. Although all of them can be used interchangeably, in this chapter, the term organization is used as an umbrella concept covering all the entities mentioned above and not-for-profit/non-governmental organizations.

text: Which of the following is NOT true in regard to the history of technological innovations?

options.A: Innovation has long been regarded as the engine of growth.
options.B: Technological innovations provide wealth for the innovator.
options.C: Technological innovations built blockages within the societies for that period.
options.D: Technological innovations provide wealth for the country where this occured.
options.E: The industrial revolution was the result of a series of technological innovations.

explanation:
Technological innovations not only provide wealth for the
innovator but also to the country where this has occurred. The industrial revolution, as we call it today, was the result of a series of technological innovations realized throughout the 19th century, which in turn became the primary building block of the progress within the societies for that period; thus, innovation has long been regarded as the engine of growth.

text: Which of the following is the definition of the term "creative destruction" put forward by Schumpeter?

options.A: A theoretical, historical, statistical analysis of business cycles.
options.B: An economic growth source driven by profit-seeking entrepreneurs.
options.C: A cross-disciplinary collaboration and interdisciplinary understanding.
options.D: A view of innovation as waves of power restructuring the whole market.
options.E: The importance of innovation to economic development, the role of entrepreneur and later the role of organized research and development.

explanation: Schumpeter popularized the term creative destruction, which views innovation as waves of power restructuring the whole market. Joseph Schumpeter argued that organizations and/or entrepreneurs who grasp the discontinuities faster than others will thrive

text: Which of the following is known as the economist who is considered as the pioneer of the modern theory of economic growth?
explanation: Later, another economist Paul Romer developed these theories further, and he is said to be responsible for the modern theory of economic growth, which is sometimes called the neo-Schumpeterian economic growth theory.

text:
Netflix has been disruptive to existing industries. Netflix has become so popular that it has challenged and had considerable negative effects on industries such as video tape rental business and traditional television channels. Thus, Netflix may be considered a good example of _______________________ in the media sector.
Which of the following completes the sentence above?
explanation:
Schumpeter argued that the development and diffusion of new technologies by profit-seeking entrepreneurs formed economic growth sources, and coined the term creative destruction, which views innovation as waves of power restructuring the whole market. Joseph Schumpeter argued that organizations and/ or entrepreneurs who grasp the discontinuities faster than others will thrive. In this example, we see that Netflix, an innovative initiative, has replaced traditional media, causing creative destruction in the sector.
The correct answer is A.

explanation:

text: Which of the following is the main role of a technological gatekeeper in an enterprise?

options.A: Managing innovation processes of an organization
options.B: Linking the organization with the external environment and vice versa
options.C: Introducing organizational theories to the company

explanation:
Thomas J. Allen introduced the term “technological gatekeepers,” which denotes a crucial role of the people linking the organization with the external environment and vice versa. Characteristics of the technological gatekeepers, or the stars to be in line with Allen’s terminology, are high communicators and high technical performers. These people are seldom found at the top of the hierarchy but are more employed at the lower levels.
The correct answer is B.

text:
A group of R&D engineers brainstorm for a product update in a biomedical company. They cross-functionally use technology to find a suitable solution. This is an example of ____________________ level of technology use in an organization.
Which of the following completes the sentence above?
explanation:
Functional level, which can also be classified as departmental level, is about how groups work to perform their work, creating competencies that constitute technology. For example, a group of R&D engineers brainstorm for a product update or an emergency team try to find out a solution for an ongoing crisis. Employees working together at the same department or employees working together cross-functionally use procedures and techniques to find a suitable solution that can be given as an example for this level.
The correct answer is B.

text: Which of the following is the definition of "innovation as a trajectory"?

options.C: A family of innovations to be derived from the source
options.D: Minor adjustments or radical changes in the innovation subject
options.E: A series of activities that are carried out by an organization for innovative outcomes

explanation:
Innovation as a trajectory is defined as a family of innovations to be derived from the source.
The correct answer is C.

Quantum technological change is about a fundamental shift in technology that revolutionizes the products or the way they are used. Quantum innovations related to quantum technological change are described as new products or operating systems that incorporate quantum technological improvements.

text:
When Apple released iTunes as a media library and music marketplace, it offered convenience and lower price for customers. iTunes has changed the channel through which consumers have access to music. As a result of this, Walkmans, CDs, MP3 players and record stores are generally considered old-fashioned ways of listening to music in today’s market.
Which of the following types of innovation did iTunes cause in the music market?
explanation:
Christensen (2003) makes a distinction between disruptive and sustaining innovations. Disruptive innovations are principally not demanded by the current customers; sustaining innovations appeal more to the current customers since these innovations are based on an established product’s betterment. Disruptive innovations introduce improvements more significant than demanded, disrupting established players in the market.
The correct answer is A.

text:
Companies can improve existing products or develop new products thanks to research and development in science. They can introduce an innovative product in the market before there is customer demand for it.
Which of the following types of innovation approaches is defined in the given paragraph?
explanation:
In the technology-push model, the innovation process is initiated by the serendipity of scientists’ unexpected discoveries, technological experts apply these discoveries to new product ideas, engineers and designers transform them into prototypes to be tested before manufacturing experts make the process possible for effective and efficient production. Finally, marketing function comes into play and crafts a sound marketing strategy based on 4Ps. Marketers make decisions mostly on the price, placement, and promotion, and less about the product. The target audience is the passive recipient of the whole process.
The correct answer is D.

explanation:
Creativity is the thinking of new and novel ideas, whereas innovation is the successful implementation of those ideas.

text: Which of the following is <u>not</u> among the characteristics of a successful innovator?

options.A: Exploring and understanding different dimensions of innovation
options.D: Creating conditions to enable the organization to repeat the innovation trick

explanation:
According to Bessant and Tidd (2015: 16), successful innovators have the following characteristics:

  • Exploring and understanding different dimensions of innovation,

  • Managing innovation as a process,

  • Creating conditions to enable the organization to repeat the innovation trick,

  • Focusing on creating the innovative capability to move their organization’s forward and

  • Building a dynamic capability.


Thus, providing limited flexibility to employees is not one of the characteristics of successful innovators.
The correct answer is C.

text: Which element of the national innovation system prepares innovation policies, controls the process, provides the necessary infrastructure, incentives, and coordination of activities and establishes the legal framework?

text: Which element of the national innovation system undertakes the task of producing and developing technological innovations?

options.B: Supporting institutions that provide technical infrastructure

explanation:
The prominent institutions and organizations that make up the national innovation system are as follows (Özdemir, 2010, p.26):
1. Political and supervisory institutions: They prepare innovation policies and control the process. These constitute indispensable elements of innovation by providing the necessary infrastructure, incentives, and coordination of activities and establishing the legal framework.
2. Science system: These actors, especially universities, undertake the task of making inventions in interaction with the public and private sectors and training the academicians and scientists to do them. The most significant advantage of universities over public R&D institutions is their ability to train qualified research staff.
3. Business sector: Firms play an essential role in implementing technological innovations and benefiting from technological changes.
4. Supporting institutions that provide technical infrastructure: They are support
organizations that offer convenience in financial matters such as loans and tax
deductions and assist in issues such as training and laboratory services.
5. Public and private research institutions: They undertake the task of producing and developing technological innovations.
